title: A Step-by-Step Guide to Creating an End Portal in Minecraft

steps.title: Open Minecraft.
steps.content: Open Minecraft. Double-click (or click on a Mac) the Minecraft app icon, which resembles a grassy block of dirt, then click PLAY at the bottom of the Minecraft launcher window.

steps.title: Click Singleplayer.
steps.content: Click Singleplayer . It's at the top of the Minecraft menu.

steps.title: Start a game in Creative Mode.
steps.content: Start a game in Creative Mode. Click Create New World in the lower-right side of the "Select World" page, enter the world's name, click the Game Mode: Survival button to switch over to Creative Mode, and click Create New World in the bottom-left corner of the page. You can also just select an existing Creative Mode world from the "Select World" page (if possible) and then click Play Selected World .

steps.title: Find a flat space.
steps.content: Find a flat space. Your End portal will need a 5-by-5 section of flat ground in order for you to be able to build it.

steps.title: Open the Creative menu.
steps.content: Open the Creative menu. Press the E key to do so. You should see a window with a list of materials appear. If you remapped your computer's key bindings for Minecraft, you may have to press a different key.

steps.title: Click the "Search" tab.
steps.content: Click the "Search" tab. It's a compass-shaped icon in the upper-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Type end into the search bar.
steps.content: Type end into the search bar. The search bar is in the upper-right side of the "Search" section. Doing this will bring up a list of all End-related ingredients, including those needed to create the End portal.

steps.title: Add End portal ingredients to your inventory.
steps.content: Add End portal ingredients to your inventory. Click the blue-and-white "End Portal" icon, click a space in your inventory bar at the bottom of the window, and repeat with the eye-shaped "Eye of Ender" icon.

steps.title: Create the End portal frame.
steps.content: Create the End portal frame. Scroll through your inventory bar until the "End Portal" block is equipped, then build the portal frame by right-clicking spaces on the ground. Keep in mind the following: [1] X Research source The End portal consists of four three-block rows which encircle a three-by-three square. The End portal's corners will consist of empty space. You must stand inside of the area which will be the inside of the End portal while constructing it, and you must stand directly in front of each block as you place it.

steps.title: Add an Eye of Ender to each frame block.
steps.content: Add an Eye of Ender to each frame block. Select the Eye of Ender in your inventory bar, then right-click the top of each block in the End portal (12 total).

steps.title: Wait for the End portal to open.
steps.content: Wait for the End portal to open. Once you've placed the final Eye of Ender, you should see the purple, starry portal open in the middle of the area that's enclosed in the frame. This is the portal to The End. You can jump through this portal to teleport to The End, which is where you'll fight the Ender Dragon. If the portal doesn't appear, your blocks are probably improperly placed. Make sure that you're facing the each End Portal block that you place from the inside looking out.

steps.content: Start a game in Creative Mode. Tap Create New , tap Create New World , tap the "Default Game Mode" drop-down box, tap Creative , tap Continue when prompted, and tap Create on the left side of the screen. You can also select an existing Creative Mode world from the "Worlds" tab if possible.

steps.content: Find a flat space. Your End portal will need a 5-by-5 section of flat ground in order for you to be able to build it.

steps.content: Open the Creative menu. Tap ⋯ in the lower-right side of the screen to do so. You should see your inventory and several tabs appear.

steps.title: Tap the "Search" tab.
steps.content: Tap the "Search" tab. It's the magnifying glass-shaped icon in the upper-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Search for your End portal ingredients.
steps.content: Search for your End portal ingredients. Tap the search bar at the top of the screen, then type in end . This will bring up a list of all End ingredients, including those needed to create your End portal.

steps.title: Add End portal ingredients to your inventory.
steps.content: Add End portal ingredients to your inventory. Tap the "End Portal" icon (which resembles a blue-and-white box in the center of the results), tap a space in your inventory bar, and then repeat with the eye-shaped "Eye of Ender" icon. If you have an item in your inventory bar, tapping it after tapping an End portal ingredient will cause the item to be replaced by the End portal ingredient.

steps.title: Create the End portal frame.
steps.content: Create the End portal frame. Select the "End Portal" block in your inventory bar, then build the three-by-three End portal by tapping the ground. Keep in mind the following: The End portal consists of four three-block rows which encircle a three-by-three square. The End portal's corners will consist of empty space. You must stand inside of the area which will be the inside of the End portal while constructing it, and you must stand directly in front of each block as you place it.

steps.content: Wait for the End portal to open. Once you've placed the final Eye of Ender, you should see the purple, starry portal open in the middle of the area that's enclosed in the frame. This is the portal to The End. You can jump through this portal to teleport to The End, which is where you'll fight the Ender Dragon. If the portal doesn't appear, your blocks are probably improperly placed. Make sure that you're facing the each End Portal block that you place from the inside looking out.

steps.content: Start a game in Creative Mode. Press the right shoulder button on your controller once to open the "Create" tab, select Create New World , name your world, select the "Game Mode" slider and move it to Creative , and select Create New World . You can also select an existing Creative Mode world from the "Load" tab if need be.

steps.title: Scroll over to the "Miscellaneous" tab.
steps.content: Scroll over to the "Miscellaneous" tab. It's the lava bucket tab in the upper-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Move the End portal items into your inventory bar.
steps.content: Move the End portal items into your inventory bar. Select the "End Portal Frame" icon (the blue-and-white box) on the right side of the menu and press Y (Xbox) or △ (PlayStation), then scroll down and repeat with the eye-shaped "Eye of Ender" icon. You should see both items in your inventory bar at the bottom of the screen.
